info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 702 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Royal Palm Hammock, or 11 miles northwest of Everglades City, moving west at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Naples, Marco Island, Cape Romano, Belle Meade, Marco Island Airport, Naples Manor, Lely Resort, Royal Palm Hammock, East Naples, Rookery Bay Aquatic Preserve, South Blocks Golde, Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Picayune Strand State Forest, Port Of The Island, Fiddlers Creek, Key Marco, and Goodland.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Collier County through 745 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County
